Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.
I ran as fast as I could.
Dad, Dad! Please, I think Mom's in trouble! There's a man in our house!
Kya!
But we were too late. When we got there, the man was gone. And so was she.
Your mother was a brave woman.
I know.
There! See those sea raven flags? It's the Southern Raiders.
Let's do this.
So there I was, and I was like, 'You know ...'
This is it, Katara. Are you ready to face him?
Who are you?
You don't remember her? You will soon, trust me.
What's ... happening to me?
Think back. Think back to your last raid on the Southern Water Tribe.
I don't know what you're talking about. Please, I don't know!
Don't lie! You look her in the eye and you tell me you don't remember what you did.
It's not him. He's not the man.
What? What do you mean he's not? He's the leader of the Southern Raiders! He has to be the guy!
If you're not the man we're looking for, who is?
You must be looking for Yon Rha. He retired four years ago.
Yon Rha! You lazy piece of work, I need something.
Yes, Mother. What is it?
The tomato-carrots from your garden are too hard for my gums. I need something soft and juicy!
Would you like something else from the garden? I would be happy to ...
Hello? Did you see someone?
Hello? Is someone there?
That was him. That was the monster.
Nobody sneaks up on me without getting burned!
We weren't behind the bush. And I wouldn't try firebending again!
Whoever you are, take my money. Take whatever you want. I'll cooperate.
Do you know who I am?
No. I'm not sure.
Oh, you better remember me like your life depends on it! Why don't you take a closer look?
Yes, yes, I remember you now. You're that little Water Tribe girl.
Just let her go and I'll give you the information you want.
You heard your mother. Get out of here!
Mommy, I'm scared.
Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.
Now tell me, who is it? Who's the waterbender?
There are no waterbenders here. The Fire Nation took them all away a long time ago.
You're lying. My source says there's one waterbender left in the Southern Water Tribe. We're not leaving until we find the waterbender!
If I tell you, do you promise to leave the rest of the village alone? It's me. Take me as your prisoner.
I'm afraid I'm not taking prisoners today ...
She lied to you! She was protecting the last waterbender!
What? Who?
Me!
I did a bad thing! I know I did and you deserve revenge, so why don't you take ''my'' mother? That would be fair!
I always wondered what kind of person could do such a thing, but now that I see you, I think I understand. There's just nothing inside you, nothing at all. You're pathetic and sad and empty.
Please, spare me!
But as much as I hate you ... I just can't do it.
Katara? Are you okay?
I'm doing fine.
Zuko told me what you did. Or what you didn't do, I guess. I'm proud of you.
I wanted to do it. I wanted to take out all my anger at him, but I couldn't. I don't know if it's because I'm too weak to do it or because I'm strong enough not to.
You did the right thing. Forgiveness is the first step you have to take to begin healing.
But I didn't forgive him. I'll never forgive him. But I am ready to forgive you.
You were right about what Katara needed. Violence wasn't the answer.
It never is.
Then I have a question for you. What are you gonna do when you face my father?
Doesn't it seem kind of weird that we're hiding from the Fire Lord in his own house?
I told you, my father hasn't come here since our family was actually happy. And that was a long time ago. It's the last place anyone would think to look for us.
You guys are not gonna believe this! There's a play about us.
We were just in town and we found this poster!
What? How is that possible?

Listen to this ... "''The Boy in the Iceberg'' is a new production from acclaimed playwright Pu-on Tim, who scoured the globe gathering information on the Avatar, from the icy South Pole to the heart of Ba Sing Se. His sources include singing nomads, pirates, prisoners of war, and a surprisingly knowledgeable merchant of cabbage."
"Brought to you by the critically acclaimed Ember Island Players."
Ugh! My mother used to take us to see them. They butchered ''Love Amongst the Dragons'' every year!
Sokka, do you really think it's a good idea for us to attend a play about ourselves?
Just sit next to me. What's the big deal?
I was just, I wanted to ... okay.
Why are we sitting in the nosebleed section? My feet can't see a thing from up here!
Don't worry, I'll tell your feet what's happening.
Sokka, my only brother! We constantly roam these icy South Pole seas, and yet never do we find anything fulfilling!
All I want is a full feeling in my stomach! I'm starving!
Is food the only thing on your mind?
Well, I'm trying to get it out of my mind and into my mouth! I'm starving!
I think he's got you pegged!
Every day, the world awaits a beacon to guide us, yet none appears! Still, we cannot give up hope! For hope, is all we have! And we must never relinquish it, even ... even to our dying breath!
Well, that's just silly. I don't sound like that.
Oh man! This writer's a genius!
It appears to be someone frozen in ice, perhaps for a hundred years.
But who? Who is the boy in the iceberg?
Waterbend! Hi-yah!
Who are you, frozen boy?
Wait, is that a woman playing me?
An airbender! My heart is so full of hope, that it's making me tearbend!
My stomach is so empty, that it's making ''me'' tearbend! I need meat!
But wait! Is that a platter of meaty dumplings?
Did I mention that I'm an incurable prankster?
I don't do that! That's not what I'm like! And I'm ''not'' a woman!
Oh, they nailed you, Twinkle Toes!
Prince Zuko, you ''must'' try this cake!
I don't have time to stuff my face! I must capture the Avatar to regain my honor!
Well, while you do that, maybe I'll capture another slice.
You sicken me!
They make me look totally stiff and humorless.
Actually, I think that actor's pretty spot on.
Let's forget about the Avatar and get massages!
Ugh.
Does this dress make my butt look fat?
Riddles and challenges you must face, if you are ever to leave this place!
Ugh! Oh!
Why did you have to steal that waterbending scroll?
It just gave me so much hope!
The Avatar is mine! Wait, who's coming?
I'm the Blue Spirit, the scourge of the Fire Nation, here to save the Avatar!
My hero!
Don't cry, baby! Jet will wipe out that nasty town for you!
Oh Jet, you're ''so'' bad.
Look! It's the Great Divide! The biggest canyon in the Earth Kingdom!
Eh, let's keep flying.
Don't go, Yue! You're the only woman who has taken my mind off of food! Wait, did you have pickled fish for dinner?
Goodbye, Sokka! I have important moon duties to take care of! And yes, I did have pickled fish!
You never told me you made out with a Moon Spirit.
Shhh! I'm trying to watch!
The Avatar is back to save the day! Yay!
Ugh!
So far, this intermission is the best part of the play.
Apparently, the playwright thinks I'm an idiot who tells bad jokes about meat all the time!
Yeah, you tell bad jokes about plenty of other topics.
I know!
At least the Sokka actor kind of looks like you. That woman playing the Avatar doesn't resemble me at all!
I don't know, you are more in touch with your feminine side than most guys.
Argh!
Relax, Aang. They're not accurate portrayals. It's not like I'm a preachy crybaby who can't resist giving overemotional speeches about hope all the time. What?
Yeah, that's not you at all.
Listen friends, it's obvious that the playwright did his research. I know it must hurt, but what you're seeing up there on that stage is the truth.
Well, here we are in the Earth Kingdom!
I'd better have a look around to see if I can find an earthbending teacher!
This is it, this must be where I come in!
I flew all over town, but I couldn't find a single earthbending master!
'' Here it comes ...
You can't find an earthbending master in the sky, you have to look underground!
Who are you?
My name's Toph, because it sounds like tough, and that's just what I am!
Wait a minute, '' I sound like a guy. A really buff guy.
Well Toph, what you hear up there is the truth. It hurts, doesn't it?
Are you kidding me? I wouldn't have cast it any other way! At least it's not a flying bald lady!
So, you're blind?
Zuko, it's time we had a talk ... about your hair, it's gone too far!
Maybe it's best if we ... split ... up!
Azula, my sister, what are you doing here?
You caught me. Wait, what's that? I think it's your honor!
Where?
She escaped, but ''how''?
If she continues drilling, this wall will come down for sure!
Haha, yes! Continue drilling! The city of Ba Sing Se can hide no longer!
No, Jet! What did they do to you?
Must ... serve ... Earth King! Must ... destroy!
Did Jet just ... die?
You know, it was really unclear.
I have to admit Prince Zuko, I ''really'' find you attractive!
You don't have to make fun of me.
But I mean it! I've had eyes for you since the day you first captured me!
Wait, I thought you were the Avatar's girl!
The Avatar? Why, he's like a little brother to me! I certainly don't think of him in a romantic way. Besides, how could he ever find out about ... this?
Oh, you're getting up? Can you get me some fire flakes? Ooh, and fire gummies!
Well, my brother, what's it going to be? Your nation, or a life of treachery?
Choose treachery, it's more fun!
No way!
I hate you, Uncle! You smell, and I hate you for all time!
You didn't really say that, did you?
I might as well have.
Avatar State, yip yip!
Not if my lightning can help it!
The Avatar is no more!
It seems like every time there's a big battle, you guys barely make it out alive. I mean, you guys lose a lot!
You're one to talk, Suki. Didn't Azula take you captive? That's right, she did!
Are you trying to get on my bad side?
I'm just saying ...
Does anyone know where Aang is?
He left to get me fire gummies, like, ten minutes ago. And I'm still waiting!
I'm gonna check outside.
Are you all right?
No, I'm not! I hate this play!
I know it's upsetting, but it sounds like you're overreacting.
Overreacting? If I hadn't blocked my chakra, I'd probably be in the Avatar State right now!
Suki, what are the chances you can get me backstage? I got some jokes I want to give to the actor me.
I'm an elite warrior who's trained for many years in the art of stealth. I think I could get you backstage!
Geez, everyone's getting so upset about their characters. Even you seem more down than usual, and that's saying something!
You don't get it, it's different for you. You get a muscly version of yourself, taking down ten bad guys at once, and making sassy remarks.
Yeah, that's pretty great!

But for me, it takes all the mistakes I've made in my life, and shoves them back in my face. My uncle, he's always been on my side, even when things were bad. He was there for me, he taught me so much, and how do I repay him? With a knife in his back. It's my greatest regret, and I may never get to redeem myself.
You have redeemed yourself to your uncle. You don't realize it, but you already have.
How do you know?
Because I once had a long conversation with the guy, and all he would talk about was you.
Really?
Yeah, and it was kind of annoying.
Oh, sorry.
But it was also very sweet. All your uncle wanted was for you to find your own path, and see the light. Now you're here with us. He'd be proud.
Ow! What was that for?
That's how I show affection.
Your Zuko costume's pretty good, but your scar's on the wrong side.
The scar's not on the wrong side!
He's coming this way!
Can I help you?
Actually, I think I can help you. I'm a big Sokka fan, but I don't think you're representing him quite as well as you could be.
Aww no, another fan with ideas.
Just hear me out. Here's something I think the real Sokka would say. What does the cabbage merchant use to fix his cabbages? A cabbage patch!
That's actually pretty good! Let me see those! "A rocky relationship" ... not bad!
Also, don't be afraid to make up some phrases, especially before an attack. Something like ... "Flying kick-a-pow!".
Who are you, anyway?
I'm just a guy who likes comedy.
Katara, did you really mean what you said in there?
In where? What are you talking about?
On stage, when you said I was just like a ... brother to you, and you didn't have feelings for me.
I didn't say that. An actor said that.
But it's true, isn't it? We kissed at the Invasion, and I thought we were gonna be together. But we're not.
Aang, I don't know.
Why don't you know?
Because, we're in the middle of a war, and, we have other things to worry about. This isn't the right time.
Well, when is the right time?
Aang, I'm sorry, but right now I'm just a little confused.
I just said I was confused! I'm going inside.
Ugh, I'm such an idiot!

Here's what you missed ... we went to the Fire Nation, and you got better, and Katara was the Painted Lady, and I got a sword, and I think Combustion Man died. Oh, look, the Invasion's about to start! Shhh!
I just wanted to let you know, Aang, that I'll always love you. Like a brother.
I wouldn't want it any other way!
Hey Toph, would you say you and Aang have a "rocky relationship"?
I told him to say that!
I hope everyone's ready for the Invasion! Slap-a-pow!
We finally made it to the Royal Palace, but no one's home!
Actually, I'm home, and I want to join you!
I guess we have no choice. Come on!
I guess that's it. The play's caught up to the present now.
Wait, the play's not over!
But it is over, unless ... this is the future.
With the energy harnessed from that comet, no one will be able to stop ... the Fire Nation!
Father, Zuko and the Avatar are at the Palace. They're trying to stop you!
You take care of Zuko. I shall face the Avatar myself!
Aang! You find the Fire Lord, I'll hold her off!
You are no longer my brother. You are an enemy!
No! I am the rightful heir to the throne!
We'll see!
Honor!
So, you have mastered all four elements?
Yeah, and now you're going down!
No! It is ''you'' who are going down! You see, you are too late! The comet is already here, and I'm unstoppable!
Noooo ...!
It is over, Father. We've done it!
Yes! We have done it! The dreams of my father, and my father's father, have now been realized! The world ... is ... mine!
That ... wasn't a good play.
I'll say.
No kidding.
Horrible.
You said it.
But the effects were decent.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: More ferocious! Imagine striking through your opponent's heart!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I'm trying.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Who wants a nice cool glass of watermelon juice?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Ooh, ooh! Me, me, me!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Hey! Your lesson's not over yet! Get back here!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Come on, Zuko. Just take a break. What's the big deal?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Fine! If you want to lounge around like a bunch of snail sloths all day, then go ahead!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Maybe Zuko's right. Sitting around the house has made us pretty lazy. But I know just the thing to change all that. Beach party!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Check out my Appa sand sculpture.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Not bad, baldy, but I've been working on my sandbending. You're gonna love this.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Whoa! Wow, you've even made a little Earth King and Bosco.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Try and top ''that'', Sokka.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Ta da!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Is that a blubbering blob monster?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No, it's Suki!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Suki, we'll all understand if you break up with him over this.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I think it's sweet.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But it doesn't even look like- Aah!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What are you doing?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Teaching you a lesson!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What happened?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Zuko's gone crazy! I made a sand sculpture of Suki and he destroyed it! Oh, and he's attacking Aang.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Get a grip before I blast you off this roof!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Go ahead and do it!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Enough!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What's wrong with you? You could have hurt Aang!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What's wrong with ''me''? What's wrong with all of you? How can you sit around having beach parties when Sozin's Comet is only three days away? Why are you all looking at me like I'm crazy?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: About Sozin's Comet ... I was actually gonna wait to fight the Fire Lord until after it came.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: After?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I'm not ready. I need more time to master firebending.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: And frankly, your earthbending could still use some work too.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: So, you all knew Aang was going to wait?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Honestly, if Aang tries to fight the Fire Lord now, he's going to lose. No offense.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: The whole point of fighting the Fire Lord before the Comet was to stop the Fire Nation from winning the War, but they pretty much won the War when they took Ba Sing Se. Things can't get any worse.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: You're wrong. It's about to get worse than you can even imagine. The day before the eclipse, my father asked me to attend an important war meeting. It was what I dreamed about for so many years. My father had finally accepted me back.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Welcome, Prince Zuko. We waited for you. General Shinu, your report.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Thank you, sir. Ba Sing Se is still under our control. However, earthbender rebellions have prevented us from achieving total victory in the Earth Kingdom.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What is your recommendation?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Our army is spread too thin, but once the eclipse is over and the invasion defeated, we should transfer more domestic forces into the Earth Kingdom.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Hmm. Prince Zuko, you've been among the Earth Kingdom commoners. Do you think that adding more troops will stop these rebellions?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: The people of the Earth Kingdom are proud and strong. They can endure anything, as long as they have hope.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yes, you're right. We need to destroy their hope.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Well, that's not exactly what I-

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: ''I'' think you should take their precious hope and the rest of their land and burn it all to the ground.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yes ... Yes you're right, Azula. Sozin's Comet is almost upon us, and on that day, it will endow us with the strength and power of a hundred suns. No bender will stand a chance against us.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What are you suggesting, sir?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I wanted to speak out against this horrifying plan, but I'm ashamed to say I didn't. My whole life, I struggled to gain my father's love and acceptance, but once I had it, I realized I'd lost myself getting there. I'd forgotten who I was.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I can't believe this.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I always knew the Fire Lord was a bad guy, but his plan is just pure evil.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What am I gonna do?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I know you're scared, and I know you're not ready to save the world, but if you don't defeat the Fire Lord before the comet comes, there won't be a world to save anymore.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Why didn't you tell me about your dad's crazy plan sooner?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I didn't think I had to. I assumed you were still going to fight him before the comet. No one told ''me'' you decided to wait.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: This is bad. This is really, really bad.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang, you don't have to do this alone.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yeah, if we all fight the Fire Lord together, we got a shot at taking him down.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: All right! Team Avatar is back! Air. Water. Earth. Fire. Fan and sword!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Fighting the Fire Lord is going to be the hardest thing we've ever done together, but I wouldn't want to do it any other way.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yeah.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: All right.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Get over here, Zuko. Being part of the group also means being part of group hugs.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: There's one technique you need to know before facing my father - how to redirect lightning. If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You turn your opponents' energy against them.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: That's like waterbending.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Exactly. My uncle invented this technique himself by studying waterbenders.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: So, have ''you'' ever redirected lightning before?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Once, against my father.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What did it feel like?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Exhilarating ... but terrifying. You feel so powerful holding that much energy in your body, but you know if you make the wrong move, it's over.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Well, not ''over'' over. I mean there's always Katara and a little Spirit Water action, am I right?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Actually, I used it all up after Azula shot you.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Oh.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: You'll have to take the Fire Lord's life before he takes yours.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yeah, I'll just do that.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Gather round, Team Avatar. In order to take out the Fire Lord - or in this case, the Melon Lord - our timing has to be perfect. First, Suki and I will draw his fire. Then, Katara and Zuko charge in with some liquidy hot offense, and while the Melon Lord is distracted, Aang swoops in ... and bam! He delivers the final blow.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Uh ... what about me?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: For now, you're the Melon Lord's forces.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: So I get to chuck flaming rocks at all of you?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Whatever makes the training feel more realistic.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Sweetness.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Mwah-ha-ha-ha!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Watch it, Toph!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I am not Toph. I am Melon Lord! Mwah-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Now, Aang!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What are you waiting for? Take him out!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I can't.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What's wrong with you? If this was the real deal, you'd be shot full of lightning right now.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I'm sorry, but it just didn't feel right. I didn't feel like myself.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: There, that's how it's done.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I have a surprise for everyone!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I knew it! You did have a secret thing with Haru!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Uh, no. I was looking for cooking pots in the attic, and I found this! Look at baby Zuko. Isn't he cute?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Oh, lighten up. I'm just teasing.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: That's not me. It's my father.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But he looks so sweet and innocent.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Well, that sweet little kid grew up to be a monster, and the worst father in the history of fathers.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But he's still a human being.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: You're going to defend him?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No, I agree with you. Fire Lord Ozai is a horrible person, and the world would probably be better off without him, but there's got to be another way.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Like what?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I don't know. Maybe we can make some big pots of glue, and then I can use gluebending to stick his arms and legs together so he can't bend anymore.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yeah, then you can show him his baby pictures, and all those happy memories will make him good again.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Do you really think that would work?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: This goes against everything I learned from the monks. I can't just go around wiping out people I don't like.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Sure you can. You're the Avatar. If it's in the name of keeping balance, I'm pretty sure the universe will forgive you.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang, we do understand. It's just ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Just what, Katara? What?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: We're trying to help!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Then, when you figure out a way for me to beat the Fire Lord without taking his life, I'd love to hear it!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang, don't walk away from this.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Let him go. He needs time to sort it out by himself.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Hey, Momo. I don't suppose ''you'' know what I should do. I didn't think so.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Okay, that's everything.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No, it's not. Where's Aang?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang? Aang!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Come on, lazy bones, let's go.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: He left his staff. That's so strange.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang's not in the house. Let's check the beach.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Look, there's his footprints. The trail ends here.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: So, he went for a midnight swim and never came back?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Maybe he was captured.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I don't think so. There's no sign of a struggle.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I bet he ran away again.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Uh-uh. He left behind his glider and Appa.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Then what do ''you'' think happened to him, oh sleuthy one?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: It's pretty obvious. Aang mysteriously disappears before an important battle? He's definitely on a Spirit World journey.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But if he was, wouldn't his body still be here?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Oh, yeah. Forgot about that.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Then he's got to be somewhere on Ember Island. Let's split up and look for him.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I'm going with Zuko! What?! Everyone else went on a life-changing field trip with Zuko. Now it's my turn.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang! Aang!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Avatar State! Yip-yip!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: And then when I was nine, I ran away again.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Uh-huh.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I know I shouldn't complain. My parents gave me everything I ever asked for, but they never gave me the one thing I really wanted, their love. You know what I mean?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Look, I know you had a really rough childhood, but we should really focus on finding Aang.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: This is the worst field trip ever.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Judging by the looks on your faces, I'm guessing you guys didn't find Aang, either.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No. It's like he just ... disappeared.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Hey, wait a minute. Has anyone noticed that Momo is missing, too?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Oh no! I knew it was only a matter of time! Appa ate Momo! Momo, I'm coming for you, buddy.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Sokka, Appa didn't eat Momo. He's probably with Aang.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: That's just what Appa wants you to think.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Get out of the bison's mouth, Sokka. We have a real problem here. Aang is nowhere to be found and the comet is only two days away.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What should we do Zuko?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I don't know. Why are you all looking at ''me''?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Well, you are kind of the expert on tracking Aang.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Yeah, if anyone's got experience hunting the Avatar ... it's you.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Zuko, I don't wanna tell you how to do your job, but why are we heading towards the Earth Kingdom? There's no way Aang's there.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Just trust me.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Come on slowpokes! Faster!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Sorry I'm late, father. Good palanquin bearers are so hard to come by these days. So, is everything ready for our departure?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: There has been a change of plans, Azula.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: What?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I've decided to lead the fleet of airships to Ba Sing Se alone. You will remain here in the Fire Nation.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But I thought we were going to do this together.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: My decision is final.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: You ... you can't treat me like this! You can't treat me like Zuko!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Azula, silence yourself.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: But it was ''my'' idea to burn everything to the ground! I deserve to be by your side!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Azula! Listen to me. I need you here to watch over the homeland. It's a very important job that I can only entrust to you.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Really?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: And for your loyalty, I've decided to declare you the new Fire Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Fire Lord Azula? It does seem appropriate, but what about you?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Fire Lord Ozai is no more. Just as the world will be reborn in fire, I shall be reborn as the supreme ruler of the world. From this moment on, I will be known as ... the Phoenix King.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: And the reason you've brought us to a seedy Earth Kingdom tavern is what now?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: June.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Oh yeah, that weird bounty hunter with the giant mole.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Mole? Her skin is flawless.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: No, she has this giant mole creature she rides around on.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: The shirshu. It's the only animal that can track Aang's scent anywhere in the world. It's the one shot we have of finding him.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: I don't know who this June lady is, but I like her.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
dialogue: Hey, Momo. I just had the strangest dream. Wait. Where are we?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Hey, I remember her! She helped you attack us!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Yup. Back in the good old days.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Oh great. It's Prince Pouty. Where's your creepy grandpa?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: He's my uncle. And he's not here.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I see you worked things out with your girlfriend.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I'm not his girlfriend!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: She's not my girlfriend!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Okay, okay. Sheesh. I was only teasing. So what do you want?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I need your help finding the Avatar.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Hm. Doesn't sound too fun.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I have Aang's staff.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Well, what does that mean?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Means your friend's gone.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: We know he's gone. That's why we're trying to find him.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No, I mean he's ''gone'' gone. He doesn't exist.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Where are we, Momo? Maybe I'm in the Spirit World? But wait. You can see me. We could both be in the Spirit World. Nope. My bending works. Maybe if we climb to the top of the island, we can figure out where we are.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: What do you mean Aang doesn't exist? Do you mean he's ... you know, dead?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Nope. We could find him if he were dead. Wow, it's a real head-scratcher. See ya.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Helpful. Real helpful.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Wait. I have another idea. There's only one other person in this world who can help us face the Fire Lord. I'll be right back with a smell sample.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: You saved your uncle's sweaty sandal? Ugh!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I think it's kind of sweet.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Let's do this.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Hey! Wait up!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: We're going to Ba Sing Se?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Your uncle's somewhere beyond the wall. Nyla's getting twitchy so he can't be too far. Good luck.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It's been a long day. Let's camp and start our search again at dawn.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It's a hexagon. It doesn't seem like normal rock. It's not made of earth. This is so strange. I wish I had some help right now. I wish I had Roku. I ''do'' have Roku!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: You're right, Aang. All the past Avatars, all their experience and wisdom, is available to you if you look deep inside yourself.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: So where am I, Roku? What is this place?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I ... don't know, Aang. But I see you are lost in more ways than one right now.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I am. I need to figure out what to do once I face the Fire Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Huh?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Well, look who's here!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Everyone expects me to take the Fire Lord's life, but I just don't know if I can do that.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: In my life, I tried to be disciplined and show restraint, but it backfired when Fire Lord Sozin took advantage of my restraint and mercy. If I had been more decisive and acted sooner, I could have stopped Sozin and stopped the war before it started. I offer you this wisdom, Aang: You must be decisive.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: What's going on? We're surrounded by old people.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Not just any old people. These are great masters and friends of ours. Pakku.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It is respectful to bow to an old master, but how about a hug for your new grandfather?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: That's so exciting! You and Gran-Gran must be so happy to have found each other again!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I made her a new betrothal necklace and everything.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Welcome to the family, Gramp-Gramp!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: How about Grand-Pakku?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: And this was Aang's first firebending teacher.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Jeong Jeong.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Master Piandao.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Hello, Sokka.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: So wait. How do you all know each other?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: All old people know each other. Don't you know that?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: We're all part of the same ancient secret society. A group that transcends the divisions of the four nations.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: The Order of the White Lotus.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: That's the one.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: The White Lotus has always been about philosophy and beauty and truth. But about a month ago, a call went out that we were needed for something important.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It came from a Grand Lotus: your uncle, Iroh of the Fire Nation.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Well, that's who we're looking for.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Then we'll take you to him.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Wait! Someone's missing from your group. Someone very important. Where's Momo?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: He's gone. And so is Aang.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Oh well. So long as they have each other, I'm sure we have nothing to worry about. Let's go!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Avatar Kyoshi. I need your wisdom.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: In my day, Chin the Conqueror threatened to throw the world out of balance. I stopped him. And the world entered a great era of peace.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Personally, I don't really see the difference, but I assure you, I would have done whatever it took to stop Chin. I offer you this wisdom, Aang: Only justice will bring peace.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I knew I shouldn't have asked Kyoshi.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: So, Bumi ... how did you end up escaping your imprisonment in Omashu?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Escape? I didn't escape. Everybody else escaped. There I was back in Omashu, waiting for just the right moment. I didn't know what or when, but I knew I'd know it when I knew it. An eclipse. That'll do it.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: What do you think you're doing?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Taking back my city! You've got no firepower. And it's payback time!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Wow! You took back your whole city all by yourself!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: So what about you guys? Did you do anything interesting on the day of the eclipse?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Nah.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No, not really.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I need to look deep inside myself.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I am Avatar Kuruk. When I was young, I was always a go-with-the-flow kind of Avatar. People seemed to work out their own problems, and there was peace and good times in the world. But then, I lost the woman I loved to Koh, the Face Stealer. It was my fault. If I had been more attentive and more active, I could've saved her. Aang, you must actively shape your own destiny and the destiny of the world.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Well, here we are. Welcome to Old People Camp.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Where ... where is he?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Your uncle's in there, Prince Zuko.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Are you okay?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No, I'm not okay. My uncle hates me, I know it. He loved and supported me in every way he could, and I still turned against him. How can I even face him?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Zuko, you're sorry for what you did, right?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: More sorry than I've been about anything in my entire life.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Then he'll forgive you. He will.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Uncle?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I am Avatar Yangchen, young airbender.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Avatar Yangchen, the monks always taught me that all life is sacred. Even the life of the tiniest spider-fly caught in its own web.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Yes. All life is sacred.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I know, I'm even a vegetarian. I've always tried to solve my problems by being quick or clever. And I've only had to use violence for necessary defense. And I've certainly never used it to take a life.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Avatar Aang, I know that you're a gentle spirit, and the monks have taught you well, but this isn't about you. This is about the world.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: But the monks taught me that I had to detach myself from the world so my spirit could be free.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Many great and wise Air Nomads have detached themselves and achieved spiritual enlightenment, but the Avatar can never do it. Because your sole duty is to the world. Here is my wisdom for you: Selfless duty calls you to sacrifice your own spiritual needs, and do whatever it takes to protect the world.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I guess I don't have a choice, Momo. I have to kill the Fire Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Uncle, I know you must have mixed feelings about seeing me. But I want you to know, I am so, so, sorry, Uncle. I am so sorry and ashamed of what I did. I don't know how I can ever make it up to you. But I'll- How can you forgive me so easily? I thought you would be furious with me.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I was never angry with you. I was sad because I was afraid you had lost your way.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I did lose my way.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: But you found it again. And you did it by yourself. And I am so happy you found your way here.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It wasn't that hard, Uncle. You have a pretty strong scent.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Wait. Is it just me, or are those mountains getting bigger?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: They're not getting larger, They're getting closer! The whole island is moving!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It's amazing Momo! The biggest animal in the world! I've gotta to swim around and find its face.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Uncle, you're the only person other than the Avatar who can possibly defeat the Father Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: You mean the Fire Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: That's what I just said!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Hmmm ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: We need you to come with us!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No, Zuko, it won't turn out well.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: You can beat him! And we'll be there to help.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Even if I did defeat Ozai, and I don't know that I could, it would be the wrong way to end the war. History would see it as just more senseless violence, a brother killing a brother to grab power. The only way for this war to end peacefully is for the Avatar to defeat the Fire Lord.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: And then ... then you would come and take your rightful place on the throne?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: No. Someone new must take the throne. An idealist with a pure heart and unquestionable honor. It has to be ''you'', Prince Zuko.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Unquestionable honor? But I've made so many mistakes.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I'll try, Uncle.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Well, what if Aang doesn't come back?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Sozin's Comet is arriving, and our destinies are upon us. Aang will face the Fire Lord. When I was a boy, I had a vision that I would one day take Ba Sing Se. Only now do I see that my destiny is to take it ''back'' from the Fire Nation, so the Earth Kingdom can be free again.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: That's why you gathered the members of the White Lotus.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Yes. Zuko, you must return to the Fire Nation, so that when the Fire Lord falls, you can assume the throne and restore peace and order. But Azula will be there, waiting for you.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I can handle Azula.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Not alone! You'll need help.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: You're right. Katara, how would you like to help me put Azula in her place?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It would be my pleasure.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: What about us? What's our destiny today?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: What do you think it is?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: I think that, even though we don't know where Aang is, we need to do everything we can to stop the airship fleet.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: And that means when Aang does face the Fire Lord, we'll be right there if he needs us.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Nothing runs faster over land or swims quicker than a giant eel hound. The air ship base is on a small island just off the Earth Kingdom shore. You should be able to intercept the fleet within a day's journey.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Thank you, Master.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: So if I'm going to be Fire Lord after the war is over, what are you going to do?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: After I re-conquer Ba Sing Se, I'm going to re-conquer my tea shop, and I'm going to play Pai Sho every day.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Goodbye, General Iroh.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Goodbye, everyone. Today, destiny is our friend. I know it.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: A lion turtle! Maybe you can help me. Everyone, even my own past lives, are expecting me to end someone's life. But I don't know if I can do it.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: The true mind can weather all the lies and illusions without being lost. The true heart can tough the poison of hatred without being harmed. Since beginningless time, darkness thrives in the void but always yields to purifying light.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: Wait for him. He will come.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
dialogue: It's time for this world to end in fire, and for a new world to be born from the ashes.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Zuko, don't worry. We can take Azula.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It's not her I'm worried about. I'm worried about Aang. What if he doesn't have the guts to take out my father? What if he loses?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Aang won't lose. He's gonna come back. He has to.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What am I holding?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: A cherry pit, Princess.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Correct. And what day is this?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It is the day of your coronation.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Yes, it is. So, please. Tell me why, on the most important day of my life, you've decided to leave a pit in my cherry?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Small? Do you realize what could've happened if I hadn't sensed the pit in time?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I suppose you could've ... choked?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Yes, then you will understand the severity of your crime.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I understand, Princess. Please, forgive me.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Oh very well, since it is a special day, I will show mercy. You are banished. Leave this palace immediately.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What are you all looking at? I have two feet that need scrubbing. And make sure you get in between the toes. I won't have my first day as Fire Lord marred by poor foot hygiene.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It's weird to say, but the comet actually looks beautiful.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Too bad the Fire Lord's about to use it to destroy the world.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: We're too late! The fleet's already taking off!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Then we're taking off, too! Where's the closest airship?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It's right ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: You sent for us, Princess. Is everything all right?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Actually, everything's not all right! Do you know how long it took you to get here?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Uh ... a few minutes, I guess.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Five, to be precise, in which time an assassin could've snuck in, done away with me and been on his merry way!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: My apologies, Princess.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Is this how you plan to treat your new Fire Lord? With tardiness and disloyalty?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: The Dai Li would never betray you!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: And I'm sure that's just what you told Long Feng before you turned against him and joined me! You're all banished!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: But ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Goodbye!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Please send in the next group on your way out!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Sshhh ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: That's how it's done!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Good work, Toph! Time to take control of the ship, take the wheel.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: That's a great idea! Let the blind girl steer the giant airship!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I was talking to Suki.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: That would make a lot more sense.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What are we going to do about the rest of the crew?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Take us down closer to the water. I've got an idea. Attention, crew, this is your captain speaking. Everyone please report to the bomb bay immediately for hot cakes and sweet cream. We have a very special birthday to celebrate.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Hey, I'm Qin Lee. I work up in communications.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Oh, hi. I work down in the engine room. That's probably why we never met before. Big airship, you know?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Yep.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: So, do you know whose birthday it is?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I can't believe the captain remembered my birthday! He really does care!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Happy birthday.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Fire Lord Ozai, here we come.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Azula, we heard what happened. Why have you banished all your servants?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: All your Dai Li agents ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: And the Imperial Firebenders?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: None of them could be trusted. Sooner or later, they all would have betrayed me. Just like Mai and Ty Lee did.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Azula, we are concerned for you and your well-being.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I'm sure you will. But considering everything that has happened today ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Perhaps it's best if you postponed your coronation.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What? Which one of you just said that?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What a shame ... there's only one way to resolve this. You two must duel each other. I order you to fight an Agni Kai!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: But ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: We're not firebenders.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: All right, fine. Lo, you're banished. Li, you can stay.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: But, I'm Li. So who's banished?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Ba Sing Se, the Order of the White Lotus is here.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Here to set you free.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Only once every hundred years can a firebender experience this kind of power.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: All right hair, it's time to face your doom.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What a shame, you always had such beautiful hair.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I didn't want to miss my own daughter's coronation.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Don't pretend to act proud. I know what you really think of me. You think I'm a monster.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Well what choice do I have?! Trust is for fools. Fear is the only reliable way. Even you fear me.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: No. I love you, Azula. I do.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: We're not gonna catch up to him in time.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: No ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Momo, time for you to go.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It's Aang! He's back!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: After generations of Fire Lords failed to find you, now the universe delivers you to me as an act of providence.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: ''Please'' listen to me. We don't have to fight. You have the power to end it here and stop what you're doing.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: You are right. I do have the power. I have ''all'' the power in the world!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Go, Aang! Airbending slice!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Shouldn't we be helping him?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: The Fire Lord is Aang's fight. We need to stay focused on stopping that fleet from burning down the Earth Kingdom.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: And how do we do that, Captain Boomerang? I can't see outside of this floating hunk of metal.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Whoa. That's ''a lot'' of fire, isn't it.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: It's gonna be a rough ride! We need to get to the top of this thing, ''fast.''

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Then what?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Watch each other's backs, and if we make it that far, I'll let you know.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Suki!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I'm okay! Just finish the mission!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Sokka, I think we've gotta ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Jump!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: By decree of Phoenix King Ozai, I now crown you Fire Lord ...

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What are you waiting for? Do it!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Sorry, but you're not gonna become Fire Lord today. ''I'' am.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: You're hilarious.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: And you're going down.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Wait. You want to be Fire Lord? Fine. Let's settle this. Just you and me, brother. The showdown that was always meant to be. Agni Kai!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: You're on.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: What are you doing? She's playing you. She knows she can't take us both, so she's trying to separate us.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I know. But I can take her this time.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: But even ''you'' admitted to your uncle that you would need help facing Azula.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: I'm sorry it has to end this way, ''brother''.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: No you're not.

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: No lightning today? What's the matter? Afraid I'll redirect it?

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Oh, I'll ''show'' you lightning!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: No!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: Zuko!

episode_name: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno
dialogue: You're weak, just like the rest of your people! They did not deserve to exist in this world ... in my world! Prepare to join them. Prepare to die!
Come on out, Avatar! You can't hide in there forever!
Toph, metalbend the rudder so it's jammed in a turning position. The ship will spiral and slam into the others.
Got it!
Have I ever mentioned how sweet it is that you invented metalbending?
You could stand to mention it more.
My leg! Hang on Toph!
Aye, aye, Captain.
Bye, space sword.
I don't think boomerang's coming back, Toph. It looks like this is the end.
How did that happen? Did boomerang come back?
No, Suki did.
Come on out, little boy. You're about to be ...
I'd really rather our family physician look after Little Zuzu if you don't mind. Zuzu, you don't look so good!
There you are, filthy peasant!
Thank you, Katara.
I think I'm the one who should be thanking you.
Even with all the power in the world, you are still weak!
In the era before the Avatar, we bent not the elements but the energy within ourselves.
To bend another's energy, your own spirit must be unbendable or you will be corrupted and destroyed.
What? What did you do to me?
I took away your firebending. You can't use it to hurt or threaten anyone else ever again.
You did it! You should've seen yourself, it was amazing! You were all like and the Fire Lord was all like
So did you, you know ... finish the job?
I'm still alive.
I learned there was another way to defeat him and restore balance. I took his bending away.
Wow! Who taught you that?
A giant lion turtle.
You have the craziest adventures when you disappear.
Well, look at you, buster. Now that your firebending's gone I guess we should call you the Loser Lord.
I am the Phoenix King!
Oh, sorry. Didn't mean to offend you, Phoenix King of Getting His Butt Whooped.
Yeah! Or how about King of the ... Guys Who ... Don't Win?
You need some help with that?
Mai! You're okay! They let you out of prison?
My uncle pulled some strings. And it doesn't hurt when the new Fire Lord is your boyfriend.
So does this mean you don't hate me anymore?
I think it means I actually kind of like you. But don't ever break up with me again!
Dad!
I heard what you two did. I am the proudest father in the world. And your mother would be proud, too.
There's my favorite warriors! I have to admit, I kind of missed the face paint. So how does it feel to be in uniform again?
It feels great!
Careful, Suki! Ty Lee is pretending to be a Kyoshi Warrior again.
It's okay. She's one of us now.
Yeah, the girls and I really bonded in prison. And after a few chi blocking lessons, they said I could join their group. We're going to be best friends forever.
I can't believe a year ago my purpose in life was hunting you down. And now ...
And now we're friends.
Yeah, we ''are ''friends.
I can't believe a year ago I was still frozen in a block of ice. The world's so different now.
And it's gonna be even more different... when we build it together.

Please. The real hero is the Avatar. Today this war is finally over! I promised my uncle that I would restore the honor of the Fire Nation. And I will. The road ahead of us is challenging. A hundred years of fighting has left the world scarred and divided. But with the Avatar's help, we can get it back on the right path and begin a new era of love and peace.
All hail Fire Lord Zuko!
I should count myself lucky. The new Fire Lord has graced me with his presence in my lowly prison cell.
You should count yourself lucky that the Avatar spared your life.
Hmph.
Banishing me was the best thing you could have done for my life. It put me on the right path. Perhaps your time in here could do the same for you.
Why are you really here?
Zuko, stop moving! I'm trying to capture the moment. I wanted to do a painting, so we always remember the good times together.
That's very thoughtful of you, Sokka. Wait, why did you give me Momo's ears?
Those are your hair loopies!
At least you don't look like a boar-q-pine! My hair is not that spiky!
I look like a man.
And why did you paint me firebending?
I thought it looked more exciting that way. Oh, you think you can do a better job, Momo?
Hey, my belly's not that big anymore. I've really trimmed down.
Well I think you all look perfect!

Earth. Fire. Air. Water. When I was a boy, my father, Avatar Aang, told me the story of how he and his friends heroically ended the Hundred Year War. Avatar Aang and Fire Lord Zuko transformed the Fire Nation colonies into the United Republic of Nations, a society where benders and nonbenders from all over the world could live and thrive together in peace and harmony. They named the capital of this great land, Republic City. Avatar Aang accomplished many remarkable things in his life. But sadly, his time in this world came to an end. And like the cycle of the seasons, the cycle of the Avatar began anew.
The White Lotus has honored my family by coming. Thank you.
Welcome.
We have investigated many claims, both here and in the Northern Tribe. All have turned out to be false.
Then you should be happy to know, your search has come to an end.
What makes you so sure your daughter is ''the one''?
Korra! Please come in here!
I'm the Avatar! You gotta deal with it!
She's strong.
She lacks restraint.
Woohoo! Hey, why all the doom and gloom, people? We should be celebrating! Three elements down, one to go!
You're getting ahead of yourself ''as usual'', Korra. We haven't decided if you passed your firebending test yet.
Ever since you were a little girl, you've excelled at the physical side of bending, but completely ''ignored'' the spiritual side. The Avatar must master both.
I haven't ignored it, it just doesn't come as easy to me. But that's why I should start training with Tenzin immediately. He's Mister Spiritual.
Do you believe she's ready, Master Katara?
Very well, Korra. It's time for you to begin your airbending training.
Yes! Finally! I mean, thank you all for believing in me.
Naga, you should have seen it! I kicked some firebender butt, and I passed! Tenzin will be here in a few days.
Naga, go! That a girl. Go! Go! Go!
Unhand me, strange woman!
That's your grandmother, Meelo.
It's so good to see all of you.
Gran Gran, I've been reading ''all'' about your old adventures. I've been dying to ask you: What happened to Zuko's mom?
Well, Jinora, it's an ''incredible'' tale--

Gran Gran, you look old. How old ''are'' you? And why is it so cold in the South Pole? Can we make a campfire, and all huddle around it, and tell scary stories, and make snowmen? And then can you make the snowmen move with waterbending and chase us? Wouldn't that be fuuun? Huh? Wouldn't it?
Pema, let me help you. Careful now, careful.
Stop doting on me. I'm not helpless, I'm just pregnant.
The baby's ''strong''. I see another airbender in your future.
All I want is one child like ''me'', a nice ''non''-bender, who doesn't blast wind in my face every five seconds.
Kya and Bumi certainly were, but Tenzin has always been ... rather serious.
Mother, ''please''.
Master Tenzin, I'm ''so'' glad you're here. I can't wait to get started.
Yes, well ...
You're going to have to tell her sooner or later.
Tell me what?
I'm afraid not. We're only visiting for the night. Then I have to return to Republic City.
I'm sorry, Korra. Your airbending training is going to have to wait.
So, how long until you're ready to teach me airbending? A week? A month?
It could be much longer.
I don't understand. Why are you making me wait?
I have a responsibility to Republic City. I am one of its leaders, and the situation there is very unstable right now.
But you also have a responsibility to teach me. Believe me, I'd be happy to find another airbending master, but you're the only one. We're stuck with each other.
I wish there were another way.
Wait, there is! If you can't stay here, then I'll go back to Republic City with you! It's perfect!
Absolutely not! The city is far too dangerous. Avatar Aang tasked us with keeping you safe while you mastered the four elements.
I know this is difficult to accept, but it's not the right time for you to come to the city.
Whatever.
Goodbye, Gran Gran!
Oogi, yip-yip!
Nice night for an escape, isn't it?
I know you do.

Aang's time has passed. My brother and many of my friends are gone. It's time for you and your generation to take over the responsibility of keeping peace and balance in the world. And I think you're going to be a great Avatar.
Thank you.
Goodbye, Korra.
Mom, Dad. I'll miss you.
We love you so much.
Thanks for the ride!
Wow, look at this place. I've never seen so many Satomobiles!
Air Temple Island. That's where Tenzin lives. You ready for a little swim, girl? Okay, okay! Food first, then air temple!
Watch out, Naga! Look out!
Watch where you're going!
Whoops, sorry about that. Excuse us. Coming through. Heads up. Eh, sorry, we're new in town.
Naga, wait. We'll take one of everything, please.
That will be twenty yuans.
Uh ... I don't have any money?
Then what good are you to me?
Don't worry, girl. The city's huge. I bet we could find a place to rustle up something to eat.
Uh, say, think I can I get one of them tasty-smelling fishies?
Oh, uh, yeah, sure.
So, do you ... live in that bush?
Yes, presently that is what I do call home. Took me a while to procure a bush that beauteous. This park is quite popular with all the vagabonds.
Hey, you've got a lot to learn, newcomer. Welcome to Republic City.
Hey, you! Stop! You can't fish here!
You best skedaddle!

Are you tired of living under the tyranny of benders? Then join the Equalists! For too long, the bending elite of this city have forced nonbenders to live as lower class citizens. Join Amon, and together we will tear down the bending establishment.
What are you talking about? Bending is the coolest thing in the world.
Oh yeah? Let me guess: you're a bender.
Yeah, I am.
Then I bet you'd just ''love'' to knock me off this platform with some waterbending, huh?
This is what's wrong with this city! Benders like this girl only use their power to oppress us!
Yeah! Get out of here!
What? I'm not oppressing anyone! You're ... you're oppressing yourselves!
That didn't even make sense.
Excuse me, I think I'm lost. How do I get to Air Temple Island from here?
Just head down this street.
You should get moving, young lady. It isn't safe.
Mr. Chung, please tell me that you have my money, or else I can't guarantee I can protect your fine establishment.
My friend here is not a music lover. Give me the money, or else -
Or else what, hoodlum?
You're the only ones who are gonna need a hospital and, for your sake, I hope there's one nearby.
Who do you think you are?
Why don't you come and find out?
What just happened?
Did she just earthbend?
Can she firebend, too?
Could she be?
Got an idea about who I am ''now'', chumps?
Come on!
Police! Freeze where you are!
Cool! Metalbenders!
I caught the bad guys for you, officers.
Arrest them!
You're under arrest, too.
From the looks of it, you smashed up a lot more than that.
Wait, you - you can't arrest me! Let me explain!
You can explain yourself all you like, down at headquarters.
Hey!
Let's see. Multiple counts of destruction of private and city property, not to mention evading arrest ... You're in a whole mess of trouble, young lady.
But there were some thugs threatening a helpless shopkeeper, and I had it ...
All right, fine. Then I want to talk to whoever's in charge.
You're talking to her. I'm Chief Beifong.
Wait, Beifong? Lin Beifong? You're Toph's daughter!
What of it?
Well then, why are you treating me like a criminal? Avatar Aang and your mother were friends. They saved the world together.
That's ancient history. And it's got diddly-squat to do with the mess you're in right now. You can't just waltz in here and dole out vigilante justice like you own the place!
Chief, Councilman Tenzin is here.
Cut the garbage, Tenzin. Why is the Avatar in Republic City? I thought you were supposed to be moving down to the South Pole to train her.
Tenzin, please, don't send me back home.
You blatantly disobeyed my wishes and the orders of the White Lotus.
Katara agreed with me that I should come. She said my destiny is in Republic City.
Don't bring my mother into this!

Look, I can't wait any longer to finish my training. Being cooped up and hidden away from the world isn't helping me become a better Avatar. I saw a lot of the city today, and it's totally out of whack. I understand now why you need to stay. Republic City does need you. But it needs me, too.
You ... ah ...
Is this your polar bear dog, miss?
Korra!

Wait. I have done my best to guide Republic City toward the dream my father had for it, but you're right. It has fallen out of balance since he passed.
